Name: Creation and distribution of a homeless bill of rights.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the creation and distribution of a homeless bill of rights

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on General Welfare
This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
This Introduction was Laid Over by Committee

Attachments.Name: Minutes of the Stated Meeting - April 14, 2022

Summary: This bill would require the Department of Homeless Services (DHS) to produce a homeless bill of rights, which would inform people experiencing homelessness about their rights and services available to them. In addition, DHS would be required to make this document available on its website and to provide it to shelters and social services offices for distribution to people experiencing homelessness.

Be it enacted by the Council as follows:\ulnone\par
\pard\ltrpar\fi720\qj\par
\pard\ltrpar\fi720\sl480\slmult1\qj Section 1. Chapter 3 of title 21 of the administrative code of the city of New York is amended by adding a new section 21-324 to read as follows:\par
\ul\'a7 21-324 Homeless bill of rights. a. Definitions. For the purposes of this section, the term \ldblquote shelter\rdblquote  means any temporary emergency housing provided to homeless adults, adult families and families with children by the department or by a provider under contract or similar agreement with the department.\par
b. The department shall create a homeless bill of rights. Such homeless bill of rights shall include information regarding the rights of individuals and families experiencing homelessness and services available for such people, including:\par
\pard\cbpat2\ltrpar\fi720\sl480\slmult1\qj 1. The right to shelter;\par
2. Access to legal services;\par
3. The right to request an interpreter and to have documents translated into other languages when interacting with city agencies;\par
4. Educational options for children experiencing homelessness;\par
5. Voting rights, voter registration and how to find polling places;\par
6. How to file a complaint and protections against retaliation for filing complaints;\par
7. Housing and financial assistance; \par
8. Protections against discrimination; \par
9. The right to request accommodations for disabilities;\par
10. Rights of individuals in shelters, including to:\par
(a) Meet privately with advocates and legal representatives;\par
(b) Leave and return to the shelter outside of curfew hours and request early and late passes;\par
(c) Participate in recreational activities; \par
(d) Be placed in a room with a person who identifies as the same gender;\par
(e) A private room with a lock for families experiencing homelessness;\par
(f) A secure locker for single adults experiencing homelessness;\par
(g) Access to bathrooms;\par
(h) Access to washing machines and dryers or to money for laundry;\par
(i) Access to space and equipment to bathe and change babies and small children; and\par
(j) Meals and accommodations for dietary needs and restrictions; and\par
11. Any other information the department deems appropriate. \par
c. No later than 90 days after the effective date of the local law that added this section, such homeless bill of rights shall be made available on the department\rquote s website\cf1  in each of the designated citywide languages, as defined in section 23-1101,\cf0  and copies shall be provided to each agency office, as defined in section 21-190, and each shelter for distribution to individuals and families experiencing homelessness. The department shall update such bill of rights to reflect any changes in law or procedure.\par
\ulnone\'a7 2. This local law takes effect immediately.\par
